meanings.definition: The action or practice of leaving a vehicle in a particular place for a period of time.
meanings.sent1: Finding parking in the crowded city can be a challenge.
meanings.sent2: The parking lot was full, so I had to search for a spot on the street.
meanings.sent3: I tried parking my toy car in the dollhouse garage, but it was too small.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a busy parking lot, full of thoughts coming and going.
meanings.sent5: The parking of the spaceship in the movie was so realistic, it felt like I was there.

meanings.definition: An area or space where vehicles can be parked.
meanings.sent1: The parking at the mall is always packed on weekends.
meanings.sent2: We found a shady spot in the parking under the trees.
meanings.sent3: The parking for bicycles was so full that they had to start using the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: The parking for ideas in his mind was organized like a neat row of cars in a lot.
meanings.sent5: The parking near the beach had a stunning view of the ocean, making it a popular spot.
